radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver shows no evidence of focal lesions or textural abnormality. There is no evidence of intra or extrahepatic biliary dilatation and the common bile duct measures 2 mm. There are gallstones seen within the gallbladder as well as a gallstone at the gallbladder neck measuring 1.4 cm which did not move despite turning the patient decubitus. There was mild gallbladder wall thickening but no pericholecystic fluid. Sonographic ___ sign was negative. The pancreas was not visualized due to overlying bowel gas. Doppler assessment of the main portal vein demonstrates patency and hepatopetal flow.
